subject: Personal Finance
title: Part-Time Work in Retirement
description: A quick, practical guide to Part-Time Work in Retirement.

hook.text: Earning just $15,000 a year in early retirement can add years to your portfolio's lifespan.

buildup.text: Even modest income reduces how much you withdraw from savings, giving investments more time to grow.

discovery.text: Part-time work also provides social connection, purpose, and structure â€” all linked to longer, healthier lives.

twist.text: But earning too much before full retirement age can temporarily reduce Social Security benefits.

climax.text: The ideal setup: flexible, enjoyable work that covers basic expenses while investments compound untouched.

punchline.text: A little earning goes a long way in retirement.

quiz.question: How does part-time work benefit a retirement portfolio?
options: It reduces withdrawals, giving investments more time to grow
It replaces the need for any savings
It increases Social Security benefits immediately
